definition: to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Venture capital transmogrified into speculative fever.
sentences.chinese: 風險資本改頭換面進入投機熱。

sentences.english: As the face of America has changed, so has the face of American racism.
sentences.chinese: 隨着美國的面貌改變，美國種族主義也改頭換面了。

sentences.english: My duff transcript did not faze the schools I applied to.
sentences.chinese: 我那份改頭換面的成績單，並沒有引起商學院的疑慮。

sentences.english: The company intends to re-fashion itself as AIU Holdings.
sentences.chinese: 公司打算改頭換面作爲美亞保險公司控股有限公司。

sentences.english: In debt restructuring, the existing debt is metaphorically torn up and replaced by new debt.
sentences.chinese: 在債務重組方面，舊債改頭換面被新債取代。

sentences.english: What this suggests is that education and healthcare are ripe for disruptive innovation.
sentences.chinese: 以上現象表明教育和醫療正亟待一場改頭換面的革新。

sentences.english: They are being shown at the Reinventing Shoe exhibition at La Capella dels Angels.
sentences.chinese: 這場奇異鞋展的名字叫作“改頭換面的鞋子”。

sentences.english: He was believed to have altered his appearance and traveled throughout Europe, Mexico, Canada and the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他改頭換面後流竄到過歐洲，墨西哥，加拿大和美國。

sentences.english: An official revision of history was quietly taking place.
sentences.chinese: 官方歷史就這樣不聲不響地改頭換面了。

sentences.english: A few simple techniques can make a big difference when your PC's performance slows to a crawl.
sentences.chinese: 只要一些簡單的技巧就能讓你的龜速電腦改頭換面了。

sentences.english: I’m most excited about the innovation of Phones That Don’t Suck.
sentences.chinese: 讓我最興奮的是改頭換面的手機的發明。

definition: to smash
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to exchange/to change places/to swap
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
foothold
to no avail/of no use
to become a mere formality
to understand profoundly/well-versed/skillful/practiced/to have the knack
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
